channel.title: Perl Weekly newsletter
channel.description: A free, once a week e-mail round-up of hand-picked news and articles about Perl.

item.title: London's Biggest Perl team
item.description: Large, dynamic Perl team in Canary Wharf looking for mid-level and senior developers. Run by a Perl-loving CTO in beautiful offices with a great view over Canary Wharf, the company manages one legacy Perl codebase and a whole bunch of very new, very shiny, and very modern codebases

item.title: Fancy a few days a week in beautiful Irvine, CA? Mountain and harbour views from the office
item.description: We are looking for a fulltime Perl developer who can join us onsite at our beautiful offices a few days a week in Irvine, and work from home the rest of the time (or fulltime in Irvine).

item.title: Perhaps the most enlightened Perl team in London, UK
item.description: Itâ€™s no secret that I used to run a Perl team myself in Central London, and was competing for talent with the other teams. By far the hardest team to compete with was the one whose technical leader was making sure his team were always using the best tools...

item.title: FOSDEM 2017 Perl DevRoom
item.description: Videos from the Perl room at FOSDEM.

item.title: Manipulating the file system with Mojo::File
item.description: Mojolicious now includes Mojo::File, a class for manipulating files. I haven't done a feature-by-feature comparison, but it's similar to Path::Tiny, if you're familiar with that.

item.title: How I got three errors into one line of code
item.description: Mark talks us through the problems he had with one line of code.

item.title: A File and Directory Usage Graph
item.description: Building a visualisation showing what's taking up diskspace, in Perl 6. This is from Moritz's book, Perl 6 by Example, a work in progress.

item.title: More Than One Zero
item.description: The weekly collection of Perl 6 news.

item.title: Else Clauses on Loops
item.description: Jeremy wondered whether anyone else would like an else clause on loops, which would be run if the body of the loop was never run. I've never wanted such a thing, but I did enjoy the comments, which illustrate that one person's "you don't need to ever use X", is another person's "I use that all the time".

item.title: Fixing Perl's Unicode problems on the command line on Windows: A trilogy in N parts
item.description: Sinan looks at some of the problems you might encounter trying to use Unicode with Perl on Windows.

item.title: Restrict the import by listing the functions to be imported
item.description: Gabor shows how to import just the functions you're going to use, when use'ing a module.

item.title: P5P Mailing List Summary: February 7th-12th
item.description: This week our happy crew spent most of their time discussing 2nd generation PokÃ©mon, and who has and hasn't got Snorlax yet.

item.title: Higher-level list utility functions with List::UtilsBy
item.description: Andy sings the praises of List::UtilsBy. This is similar to List::Util, but provides functions that take a block which controls how the function works.

item.title: NICEPERL's lists
item.description: Miguel Prz (NICEPERL)'s regular lists: Great modules released last week; MetaCPAN weekly report; StackOverflow Perl report.
